title: cgroup memory limit should exclude swap

labels.name: P2
labels.description: We'll consider working on this in future. (Assignee optional)

labels.name: team-Local-Exec
labels.description: Issues and PRs for the Execution (Local) team

body:
### Description of the bug:

If you set any of the memory limits like `--experimental_sandbox_memory_limit_mb` it will set `memory.max` to enforce memory limits **however** this can be confusing if swap is enabled on the machine allowing the memory to be exceeded beyond the value set.

### Which category does this issue belong to?

linux-sandbox

### What's the simplest, easiest way to reproduce this bug? Please provide a minimal example if possible.

Here is a command to use cgroup and run a binary that will consume memory indefinitely.
I set it to **20MiB**
```
bazel --experimental_cgroup_parent=/user.slice/user-4044.slice/user@4044.service/app.slice/bazel test //:eat_memory_test --experimental_sandbox_memory_limit_mb=20 --spawn_strategy=linux-sandbox --test_output=streamed
```

I have **swap enabled**

```
 swapon --show
NAME          TYPE SIZE USED PRIO
/tmp/swapfile file   2G 1.3M   -2
```
